children: team up for the first time on “Godzilla,” where they compare themselves to monsters. In particular, they become
, a fictional sea monster that is known for its mass destruction and endless killing.
While this track marks the first collaboration between Juice WRLD and Eminem, Juice had previously
listed Em as one of his biggest influences
and has frequently referenced his music, perhaps most notably on his May 2018 track,
freestyled an hour over different Eminem beats
This track also serves as Juice WRLD’s first posthumous release since his

on December 8, 2019—six days after his 21st birthday. Juice reportedly recorded the chorus for the track before his untimely death, although he was unable to complete his actual verse for the song in time. Later, on January 17, 2020, a
that depicted Juice WRLD and his friends after he recorded his feature.
, producer d.a. got that dope broke down how the song came together.
On February 5, 2020, the song received a Gold certification by
making it the first official certification for the single.
The official music video dropped March 9, 2020. Directed by
, one of the biggest names in music video production, and starring
, portraying a young Eminem. Juice WRLD appears in the video as well using older stock footage.
